item.title: Human vs JSON output formatting: avoid mixing concerns
item.description: Two of the original ideas about Unix is that each program should do one thing and that programs should be able to be combine so they consume each others' output. This led to the convention and tradition that Unix command line programs produce output that's relatively easy for other programs to parse.

item.title: Thoughts on the ‚ÄúWiner WordPress Tease‚Äù ‚Äì Andy Sylvester's Web
item.description: Dave Winer has been promoting his editor for WordPress sites, called WordLand, leading up to his keynote speech at WordCamp Canada in October 2025, as well as hinting about other WordPress-related projects. Recently, he asked readers to ‚ÄúThink Different About WordPress‚Äú, where he talks about how WordPress supports editing features that Mastodon and Bluesky do not support (linking, no character limits, and other features). WordPress also has ‚Äúexcellent support‚Äù for RSS and rssCloud, and has a ‚Äúdeep and powerful API‚Äú.

item.title: The Micro SaaS Revolution: From Giants to Solopreneurs

item.title: Chess Variant
A look at a P2P camera (LookCam app)
item.description: I‚Äôve got my hands on an internet-connected camera and decided to take a closer look, having already read about security issues with similar cameras. What I found far exceeded my expectations: fake access controls, bogus protocol encryption, completely unprotected cloud uploads and firmware riddled with security flaws. One could even say that these cameras are Murphy‚Äôs Law turned solid: everything that could be done wrong has been done wrong here.
